{ "rules": { "security-schemes-oauth-allowed-flows":{ "description": "The OAuth2 authorization framework defines various [grant types](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.3), most notably the [AuthorizationCode](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.3.1) and the [Client Credentials](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-1.3.4). Some grant types are now considered insecure and MUST not be used, including `implicit` and `password`. The new [OAuth2.1](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-1-01) still in draft, removes them and suggests to replace the `implicit` with `authorizationCode` + PKCE defined in RFC7636.", "message": "Do not use oauth2 insecure flow: "{{property}}".", "formats": ["oas3"], "severity": "error", "recommended": true "given": ["$.[?(@.type==\"oauth2\")].flows"], "then": [{"field":"implicit","function":"falsy"},{"field":"password","function":"falsy"}] } } }
